answer:
**Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis**

• **Frame 1**  
  – Sign cluster on the median indicates two left‐turn lanes (one strictly left, one left‐or‐through).  
  – To the right of those, multiple lane dividers are visible, suggesting at least three lanes continue forward.  

• **Frame 2**  
  – Slightly closer look confirms a split median and bollards that begin separating the two left‐turn lanes from the remaining lanes to the right.  
  – Lane markings to the right show distinct dashed lines, hinting at three separate lanes continuing forward.  

• **Frame 3**  
  – Clearly shows two large left‐turn arrows (far left lane plus the lane immediately to its right).  
  – To the right of the bollards, three lanes extend ahead.  

• **Frame 4**  
  – The yellow posts on the median further isolate the dual left‐turn pocket from the three lanes on the right.  
  – Pavement markings (“CLEAR,” “KEEP”) are spread across those three right lanes, confirming there are indeed three lanes in that segment.  

• **Frame 5**  
  – Best overall view. Two left‐turn lanes (separated by the posts) plus three lanes continuing straight or possibly turning right.  
  – No evidence of a sixth lane for the ego direction beyond those five.  

**Contextual Reasoning**  
Across the frames, we consistently see two lanes allocated for left turns, physically separated by an island or bollards from three other lanes. No additional lane markings appear for a sixth lane.  

**Matching to Answer Choices**  
• **3 lanes (A)** too few, because we see two left‐turn lanes plus at least three going straight.  
• **4 lanes (B)** still too few, given the two clearly marked left‐turn lanes plus three to the right.  
• **5 lanes (C)** matches what is visible: two left‐turn lanes and three lanes to the right.  
• **6 lanes (D)** no markings indicate a sixth lane.  

<answer>C</answer>
